subject: Re: [junit] know any Metric tools?
msgSnippet: The JDK 1.3+ has a some interesting performance analysis features. It takes requires a tool to analyze, but the info provided is fairly rich. I am not sure if
messageBody:
The JDK 1.3+ has a some interesting performance analysis features.
It takes requires a tool to analyze, but the info provided is fairly rich.
I am not sure if this is what you are looking for, but there is significant
metrics on method call frequency and execution time.
Here is a javasoft article with the appropriate links.
http://developer.java.sun.com/developer/technicalArticles/Programming/perfan
al/index.html

----- Original Message -----
From: <kgip@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, August 08, 2001 4:33 PM
Subject: [junit] know any Metric tools?


> I am familiar with JDepend and find it quite beneficial at the
> package level on caller/called (afferent/efferent)metric and like the
> instability measurement. However I have also been asked to find
> metrics for funtion caller/called with locations (line #, etc),
> totals of what programs use a specific method, etc. Looked at CDOC
> for Java, C++, and C. Wondering if anyone has used the metric
> portions of JEDIT or if you know of a tool "that will do it all".
>
>
>

> junit-unsubscribe@yahoogroups.com
